title: Mexico's 2020 budget sees a 0.7% primary fiscal surplus
text:
Mexico's 2020 budget sees a 0.7% primary fiscal surplus

Economic Indicators 51 minutes ago (Sep 08, 2019 06:41PM ET)

MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico's government expects a 0.7% primary fiscal surplus in its 2020 budget, a blueprint released on Sunday shows, as President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador aims to balance spending priorities with a slowing economy. Lopez Obrador's second budget since winning a landslide election victory last year aims to boost spending on social welfare programs, security and state-run oil company Pemex, while at the same time eschewing new taxes or fuel price spikes.

Mexico's 2020 budget sees a 0.7% primary fiscal surplus
description: Mexico's 2020 budget sees a 0.7% primary fiscal surplus
